result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey J Makowski

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att De La Rosa

Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF350 & 22CF397 called at 1:47 PM 
Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct, but notes that Jefferson County Jail should be added to mailing matrix as Mr. Makowski may remain in custody for some time. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond in each case with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 

The Court notes exception to SCRAM condition, if Defendant, is placed back on SCRAM through Justice Point in Milwaukee Co Case, SCRAM through Jefferson County is NOT required. 
recess 1:56  pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/2/22 at 8:30am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 11/18/22 at 9:30am

[ae] cases 22cf350 and 22cf397 called 10:46 AM  Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski not in court.  ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
As to each case: The State requests warrants to be issued.  Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and issues warrant. Defendant may be released upon the posting of $250, the issuance of a new court date, and the signing of a bond with the new court date
Recess 10:47 AM
